todayPage.aiConsultPrompt: Please provide a detailed analysis of my Bazi, including the meaning of the four pillars, five elements balance, Yong Shen preferences, and their impact on my personality and fortune.

baziTermExplanations.jieCai: Rob Wealth represents competition. It indicates meeting competitors and needing to actively strive for resources.
baziTermExplanations.shangGuan: Hurting Officer represents talent and creativity, but may bring disputes. People with it are usually smart but should watch their words.
baziTermExplanations.yiMa: Post Horse represents change and travel. People with it tend to travel frequently or change jobs, suitable for mobile careers.
baziTermExplanations.yongShen: Yong Shen is the most beneficial element for the Day Master. Supplementing it can improve fortune and is the core of Bazi analysis.
baziTermExplanations.jiShen: Ji Shen is the unfavorable element for the Day Master. It needs to be avoided or resolved to prevent negative effects.
baziTermExplanations.xiShen: Xi Shen is the beneficial element that can enhance fortune and bring good luck.
baziTermExplanations.pianCai: Indirect Wealth represents unexpected income and investments. People with it can easily earn through side businesses.
baziTermExplanations.zhengCai: Direct Wealth represents stable income and salary, the main source of earnings.
baziTermExplanations.zhengGuan: Direct Officer represents career, status, and responsibility. People with it are usually responsible and suited for management.
baziTermExplanations.qiSha: Seven Killings represents pressure and challenges, but also courage and execution. People with it are capable but stressed.
baziTermExplanations.zhengYin: Direct Seal represents learning, wisdom, and benefactors. People with it have strong learning abilities.
baziTermExplanations.pianYin: Indirect Seal represents unconventional knowledge and special skills. People with it may have talents in unique fields.
baziTermExplanations.shiShen: Eating God represents enjoyment, talent, and good fortune with food. People with it usually have refined tastes.
baziTermExplanations.biJian: Companion represents friends, colleagues, and competition. People with it have good social connections.
baziTermExplanations.daYun: Grand Cycle represents fortune changes every 10 years, affecting major life transitions.
baziTermExplanations.liuNian: Annual Cycle is the yearly fortune change, an important short-term reference.
baziTermExplanations.liuYue: Monthly Cycle is the monthly fortune change, affecting specific events that month.
baziTermExplanations.liuRi: Daily Cycle is the daily fortune change, affecting specific events that day.
baziTermExplanations.shiShenTerm: Ten Gods are the relationships between Heavenly Stems, including Direct Officer, Seven Killings, etc.
baziTermExplanations.wuXing: Five Elements are Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth, representing different attributes and energies.
baziTermExplanations.tianGan: Heavenly Stems are Jia, Yi, Bing, Ding, Wu, Ji, Geng, Xin, Ren, Gui, representing time units.
baziTermExplanations.diZhi: Earthly Branches are Zi, Chou, Yin, Mao, Chen, Si, Wu, Wei, Shen, You, Xu, Hai, representing time and direction.
baziTermExplanations.shenShaTerm: Spiritual Stars are special combinations in Bazi representing fortune indicators.
baziTermExplanations.taoHua: Peach Blossom represents romance. People with it attract the opposite sex but may face emotional complications.
baziTermExplanations.yangRen: Blade represents strength and impulsiveness. People with it are strong-willed but need emotional control.
baziTermExplanations.kongWang: Void represents emptiness. Stems/Branches with it may indicate things easily falling through.
baziTermExplanations.chong: Clash is the relationship between Earthly Branches, representing conflict and change.
baziTermExplanations.he: Combination is the harmonious relationship, representing cooperation opportunities.
baziTermExplanations.xing: Punishment is the conflicting relationship, indicating disputes and troubles.
baziTermExplanations.hai: Harm is the harmful relationship, requiring caution in those years.
